ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Didn't interact with either of them.
Got help from the professor, not a TA.
Instructor: Mercedes Aurelia Bravo  Mercedes
Instructor: Mercedes Aurelia Bravo  Mercedes Bravo
Instructor: Xiao Yang  She was wonderful!
Instructor: Xiao Yang  Xiao
Instructor: Xiao Yang  That was her

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: JDRS is one of my favourite profs. This course was so much more fun and informative than I expected.
Given that I am not a natural mathematician, this course was fantastic. I really, really enjoyed it.
JDRS is awesome. He makes a snorefest (stats) fun!
Lectures were amazing! One of the best lecturers I've ever had.
Professor R-S is just awesome. He is engaging, intellect, extremely learned in his field, and a super person in general. He has a good heart and is an absolutely incredible teacher.

I think the professor is great and very helpful and available to help students with the very challenging material in this course. I felt that the material itself was just very difficult and seemed more mathematical than I would ever actually use in a job.

The professor is very entertaining and clearly cares a lot about the material, but I usually had no idea what he was talking about. The information was presented in a way that was not conducive to my learning, and instead was too abstract and too fast.
Jonathan is a great professor, who is very accessible and puts a lot of effort into his teaching.

I loved this class. I found it extremely applied and directly useful for my work, which meant I enjoyed and retained information. Furthermore and better yet, I am already using many of the concepts to improve my research.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The professor
JRS's application of the material to real-world examples was incredibly valuable. It helped me understand how each test could be used in my own work.
JDRS is a great prof.
professor reuning-scherer is a lovely person who clearly cares a lot about his students
lectures! homework assignments really helped me understand the material.

Using one's own dataset at the beginning of the course, though I wish I would've spoken with someone earlier about which tests I could reasonably do with it.Learning multiple statistics programs was great, though this process could be improved.
Entertaining instructor.
Lectures were just fantastic, and the class notes were clear and very valuable.
Fantastic engaging lectures that go beyond how to run tests, but why the math works

The homework and final project did help to get a handle on the material. The flexibility that the professor provided in choosing which program to use and the guidance that he gave to get through the assignments. I also really enjoyed working in a group on my homework and project.
Practical, Useful, Job oriented skill
application of methodologies
Professor's humor
The enthusiasm and level of care of professor
This course provides a great introduction to multivariate statistical methods, and you get an overview of the different methods available to make sense of messy data
Professor's accessibility

The answer is how he taught to so many level and statistical programs. It was magic and I am not just using that word because it is a fun word to use. This meant that people from very different disciplines and experience levels could take what they wanted- if you were an anthropologist who just wanted to know what was out there you could use spss and just get the concepts. If you were an econ Ph D. you could spend time trying to understand all the formulas and doing everything in R. To be honest, I came into the class with almost not experience and was very nervous, so I started off easy, but by the end I was using R for all of the word. This meant that I focused on using the program and how to apply it to my work, but did not focus on learning the forumla behind the stats test.I really like these options and it allowed me to very easily customize this course to my needs.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Not much.
I would focus on fewer topics but go more in depth. It was kind of broad strokes over a lot of material, and it might have been good to go deeper in some areas.

More resources should be advertises or provided for learning the multiple statistics programs. For example, the R workshop was only minimally helpful. Even with the written code, I didn't know how to read all of the parts and had difficulty changing them correctly. Expanding the workshop would've been helpful.The lecture notes have some holes that make it difficult when trying to refer back with one's own results - especially in MANOVA.The beginning of the course was long and boring, but made more sense once we got into PCA. Integrating this earlier may be helpful?The statistics flowchart, while helpful, is not entirely clear. A more detailed flowchart or outline.
Pace a bit fast at some points.
The TAs were not very active or engaged.
could have been a little more structure or suggestions for the final project.
Moving slower in lecture so that students can follow along more easily without getting lost.
Overall fairly good
pace
I know it's said every year, but the pace is a bit too fast...
Figuring out how to explain the concepts from a bigger picture first, before jumping into all of the details
I very much enjoyed the lectures, but I would suggest moving a little more slowly
TAs' accessibility
It should start on time.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No lab section.
JDRS was always very helpful and patient during office hours.
Not applicable
N/A
Professor helped a lot in the lab sections. He offered even extra office hours.
lectures were really good and enjoyable which I never thought I would say about a stats course.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: I didn't work with any of the teaching fellows.
I didn't attend any.
comments were occasionally too brief to be helpful
I preferred to just go to the instructor. He was great with office hours.
Instructor: Mercedes Aurelia Bravo  Good grading
Instructor: Xiao Yang  She was so helpful and thorough. I could tell she cared a lot, and she knew her stuff so well!

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Very applicable - statistics will be an integral part of my research and taking this course before performing my thesis research is invaluable as it has helped me appropriately design my summer project.
Statistical analysis is helpful for any field IMO.

Course provided statistical analyses that I will likely not use heavily in my future research. For this reason, might not be good for someone with my interests (economics), but would recommend for others more in natural sciences.

Statistical analysis underlies much of the information we use in policymaking. A thorough understanding of its methods, capabilities and shortcomings is therefore extremely helpful for making better-informed policy decisions.
It is an analytic tool. I can use these skills on my research.
Terrific- knowing the underpinnings of multivariate statistics is super valuable to my research.
quantitative analysis to supplement/analyze my qualitative research/original dataset. also, it helps to read quant studies.
Gave me very useful statistical skills.
It provides me an understanding of research methods
I want more quantitative analysis experience
Great stats preparation. Recommend to all FES Students.

Multivariate Statistics is very useful for anyone doing anything that involves data, be it on energy use or rainfall in ecosystems. This course gives you the tool to take a mass of data and figure out which variables are important.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I need to analyse my data
To prepare for my summer research project. I also want to be able to perform and interpret my own statistical results in my career, and this course is invaluable for that.
#1 is JDRS is a fantastic teacher.#2 is that stats is useful.
to learn how to use statistical analysis software to do complex regressions
To learn more stats for potential future research.
See above.
It will be useful for research
It is important!
add statistical skills
I wanted to get more experience with statistics and quantitative analysis.
I needed knowledge of statistical tools.
because I was interested in learning more about statistical research methods
To make these statistical concepts stick in my brain a bit more.
More quant
To better understand statistics and use software.
See Q20
Broaden scope of statistical knowledge

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes!
Exceeded my expectations!
yes... though I hope to take it again next year to gain a better appreciation of stats.
i did gain some skills using the software, and the ability to tell to some extent which tests are appropriate when. the conceptual stuff was all over my head, though.
yes!

Somewhat. Some of the last few topics covered (factor analysis, structural equations modelling), which were of great interest, were unfortunately somewhat rushed. Other than that, skills and knowledge gained were quite useful.
Yes
Absolutely. I would have liked to learn a bit more in depth about some of the subjects, such as MANOVA. I felt that that section, including the homework, was a little glossed over.
yes, beyond
No, I do not feel that I really gained skills in statistics that I will be able to use on my own to apply to a problem in a job.
Yes/ however, I wished I could get more time to work on the topics.
yes
Yes
No - the course moved too fast for me to pick up a lot of it.
No, I learned very little that I could actually use in this course.
Yes. Very much so.
Yes.
Yes
Yes
R, and many stats tests relevant to social sciences.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The advantage was being able to work through problems together. The disadvantage was scheduling time to do so, although that is true of any group project.
Organizing meetings was a pain. And planners don't mix well with fly-by-the-seat-of-your-pants(ers). But it's all working out. :)
all advantages--we really helped each other learn and it made stats kind of fun!
Love the group work because everyone brought different expertise. Recommend finding a group where people have different strengths/weaknesses.
I learnt many things from my group members
Great opportunity to learn collectively. Great experience.
Different perspectives on the same problem.
Working at different paces
The work group was a great way to learn from other students and discuss the material we learned in class.
Very helpful.
advantage was that there were check and balances on our approach to research
Our group was a hodgepodge of different interests, and so we lacked the focus required to make the groupwork edifying.
Good to bounce ideas off of others
Sometimes it is hard to learn by experience as the person who is strongest sometimes does the section of hw since we were under deadlines and had to complete assignments.
Enhanced the experience of doing problem sets and the final project
Scheduling was difficultCollaboration was pedagogically useful
It was generally positive. We shared the workload and helped fill in gaps in knowledge for things that came easier to one of us rather than the other.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do it!
Take it! Very informative and approachable way to learn MVS.
If you like JDRS (most of us do) and you want to understand statistical analysis, then this course is good for you.
work with friends
Good for natural sciences research. May not be as relevant for econ / social science research.
Start with a large and versatile dataset. Work with your dataset from the beginning, it will save you a lot of work later. Pick one program and stick to it.
Take it
Great class to take, great instructor.

go to lecture even if you already know the technical procedure because lectures are awesome for deeper understanding of what the computer is doing and the strengths and weaknesses of different specifications/tests

Take this course if you are very strong in math and think that you will actually be doing intense statistical analyses. It seems to be more for students interested in academic work than most professional work.
Practice !
make sure to have your own data set

The one thing I would say is that this couse is better designed for those who have research topics and stick to them, and who can pick a piece of software and stick to it. The earlier you have these choices nailed down, the more you'll learn.Oh and also, listen to him when he recommends that you buy a textbook!
Know a lot about statistics if you want to get something out of the class.
Invest time at the beginning forming a group and picking good, interesting data to use throughout the semester
Don't hesitate to approach the professor with questionsUse your own data for homework assignments
take it.
